title: Am i the only one who doesnt want Voice Chat in league?
body:
The last thing i need is to hear somebody's legit flaming, arguing with parents, or Porn blasting through the thing just to troll. Even if you could turn it off, that would be a huge disadvantage.
Im fine with using curse and skype because you actually have to be invited to the call and trolling with friends can be handled easily, but a voice chat where you cant even control whos in it or how badly they might misuse the system is just a bad idea to me.

The tribunal just couldn't work for voice either. People would just stop typing and be toxic via voice, since it is much harder to control voice over text. Instead of having a system that detects toxic text messages, they would have to listen to long audio logs.

Yes in 2016 it is not feasible...


Really?

"It is the current year"?

Can this argument be a logical fallacy yet?
The current year has nothing to do with it. There isn't a way to mass monitor voice chat that isn't horribly huge in data costs, such as bandwidth to save the data for EVERY match, for the tribunal, right now that is just a text file, which is 1-3 kb. Riot doesn't save replays for tribunal cases because it is just to large, and audio files for every match would be even larger then a replay.

Plus, they would need an automated system that can tell friendly banter from aggressive and toxic speech. It just is not feasible, no matter what the current year is.
Be realistic, how many of your games has a toxic player in it? Look at CS:GO for example, the voice chat in that is fine.

When someone dies in a game like call of duty, it doesn't grant the one who killed them more power. I think that's why the game is so toxic tbh. When you make a mistake, it doesn't cost you, it costs your entire team.
I hate the saying but it is a team game so...
Well I'm not complaining lol, I'm just pointing out there'd be more toxicity in a game like this rather than a FPS so it's difficult to compare
honestly since dynamic queue, about 60-70%
It's 20 goddamn 16 how is it we still have poor arguments like that being made!

It's a fair argument. Transferring audio is much more costly than a simple .txt. From what people post, the text files being sent are 5kb at best. Assuming that's about 5 minutes of audio, an MP3 file of the same length is about 10MB. 2,000x the size of the similar text files and that's assuming that each sentence is stated fairly close together. Which they're not in most cases. Most are throughout the course of an entire game which would make it at LEAST 20 minutes in length. Shorter on pretty rare occasions.

In case you want my math to double-check if I'm right or not:

1Kb = 1,000b

5Kb = 5,000b

1Mb = 1,000Kb = 1,000,000b

10Mb = 10,000Kb = 10,000,000b

10,000,000b / 5,000b = 2,000

You know - ive always thought voice chat was a good idea. I dont mute people in League no matter how toxic they are, but ive found myself multiple muting people in CS:GO. 

Though to be fair, there is very little toxicity. I think the human voice forces people to recognize the person behind the computer, and stops them from saying things they wouldnt say in life (though I've heard people tell kids to stop talking on the mic if they sound prepubescent). There is very little flaming or anything. Its just spam. 

All. The. Time.

Would immediately mute everyone in the game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1n7KstfRzvs
Siv HD has gone through this situation in the past. He's got a very interesting take on it.

Even though I really wouldn't like voice chat in-game, he makes some good points. What could be a problem is that people might rely more on voice chat, so if you had this one guy you had to mute or who doesn't use voice chat, you'd still have to ping and write all the stuff. And while on NA most people are able to speak english, in Europe this would be more problematic. French people are generally quite bad at english (not saying french people are bad, but other languages are not liked this much in France), even I have lots of people in my friendlist who are 16 and can't even understand the most fucking simple english ever written and I don't think this would get any better in EUNE, since you've got even more languages there and those who don't speak english couldn't make any good use of a voice chat.

I think it could be a good thing if, you, the player, could opt-in or opt-out of the voice chat service. Not the same thing as "muting" other players that you're automatically connected to. If you aren't opted in, then you aren't going to be connected to other players by voice AT ALL. And if you do opt-in, then you can mute as you please.

One of Riot's concerns is that it will be harder to track voice chat logs for toxicity, which is legitimate. Hard to automate toxicity detection when it comes to sound waves, as opposed to reference-able text.
I'd like the option to enter into party chat with friends, otherwise, no. Pings are fine for game-communication

Just make it like all chat: Off by default.

I just can't fathom why people are opposed to completely optional additional features.
Because then you have to choose between personal enjoyment or a competitive advantage. And that's just not a good choice to have to make.

So you're basically arguing that it should be harder to communicate with your team just so you can ignore voice chat without playing at a disadvantage? 
Why don't we disable chat (and pings) altogether while we're at it? Would solve 95% of all flaming and toxicity in league!

Voice chat is along with sandbox mode and a replay system one of the things league desperately needs.
If you get easily offended by players abusing the system you can turn it off. But other players must be able to see who is participating in the voice chat and who not.
When I play dota, or even ANY game with a voice chat, there's rarely a problem with flamers. The only reason why we don't have voice chat yet is because Riot is too afraid of all the crybabies in the community that would demand moderation of the voice chat, which is not possible by an automated system.

And there is it friends.  The ugly truth.  Riot wants their moderation (In game, not on the boards) to be automatic.  Automated.  So they don't have to pay people to do something outside making content.  It would be impossible for an automated system to moderate sound waves.

Even when I played MW2 a long while back, I never ran into anyone going on a rant and cussing everyone out.  And this is CoD we're talking about.  One of the most negative lighted communities back in the day.

How is it possible that I never heard anyone go berserk in a game with one of the most negatively lighted communities around?  Normally, once someone's literal voice is thrown into the mix, anonymity is thrown out the window.  Once you start using your voice, things become more personal.  Do people still go berserk even with a voice chat?  Yeah, but it's so few and far between that saying it's a negative that outweights the positive is a lie.

I actually am curious if most of the people who don't want voice chat have played Ranked games with voice chat in other games before.  I find that besides the very occasional whiner, the flame isn't as bad as text only games I've played.  

Casual/normal game modes on the other hand are filled with what you described: trolls, loud music, porn sounds, flame.  But because they're casual games, my muting threshold is much, much lower so the instant I hear them speak i mute them and actually get less pissed than in a text only game such as league because I mute the person before I even get mad.  

My experience with voice chat enabled games when I get a team of people who speak is great.  I find a lot of people who have mics don't talk, and the flame is generally less than text only games.  But that is only in my experience.
